2.cq: In two months’ time, we’ll have celebrations for the New Year.
2.translation: e 'ua me'ama i toe, e ha'i tatou i te ko'ika ponane

4.cq: This time, the people from village X will all be coming to our community.
4.translation: tenei vai'ia, o te mata'eina'a mei x, o 'atou paotu te he'e mai io tatou

5.cq: men and women, children, old people, entire families…
5.translation: te vahana vehine, to'iki, koko'oua, kakaraua paotu

6.cq: We should welcome them in a friendly way

7.cq: just like they did to us last year
7.translation: me ta 'atou i apu'u mai i te 'ehua i pao nei

9.translation: me he mea ta tatou i hani

10.cq: Our leaders will start with a welcome speech.
10.translation: na to tatou akati'a e pepe'u ma 'oto o titahi (tapatapa) tuku'ia ma'akau

11.cq: Then, people will play in the morning.
11.translation: i mu'i mai, e ha'apao atu ai i titahi pure

12.cq: After that, we’ll all share lunch together.
12.translation: ia pao, kaikai atu ai tatou paotu

13.cq: In the afternoon, I hope we can have songs and dances.
13.translation: i te hope ahiahi, e ha'apao'ia mai i titahi tau ko'ika, te 'ori, himene

14.cq: The people of X will sing their songs, dance their dances;
14.translation: to x me ta 'atou haka, me ta 'atou himene

15.cq: we too, we shall sing our own songs, and do our own dances…
15.translation: ati'i me tatou, himene tatou ta tatou iho haka

17.translation: paotu tatou mea hei me te himene me te haka

18.cq: Then our elders will tell stories from the olden times, for the young to hear.
18.translation: e tekao te tau hamua i te tau tekao atua

21.cq: And then, in the late afternoon, our two communities will part again.
21.translation: i te ma'uahiahi, e paeke atu ai na pūpū

22.cq: This will be the end of a day of celebration.
22.translation: me te tomi atu i te ko'ika

23.cq: Remember that you and I are in charge of the organization this year.
23.translation: umo'i e ha'atuha'e, na taua e ha'apei te ha'anaho'ia no tenei 'ehua

24.cq: We should organize a meeting tomorrow morning in the community to tell our people what they should do
24.translation: e ha'atupu ha'ana taua i titahi putu'ia mataq'eina'a o'io'i popou'i me te ha'avivini i te po'i te hana ta 'atou e hana

25.cq: Some of us will clean the village.
25.translation: o tatou no te ha'aporopa i te tohua o te ka'avai

26.cq: Other people will make the costumes for the dances.
26.translation: tahipito e ha'apei i te kahu ko'ika

27.cq: We must choose which dances to showcase and we must rehearse them
27.translation: e ha'apao atu tatou e aha te haka me te ha'apei me te ha'amau

29.cq: we’ll have to prepare enough food for two hundred people.
29.translation: e, umo'i e ha'atuha'e e ha'apei me te kaikai ie, e hatu hana tena na te 'enana paotu

30.cq: Oh dear, that will be so much work for us all.
30.translation: ie, e hatu hana tena na te 'enana paotu

31.translation: oia mea nui te hana. oia hua mea e ha'amata mei tenei
